shortdesc: CEO @clever_cloud PaaS cloud computing company. About entrepreneurship, technologies, startups, cloud, nosql, java/scala/JVM, html5 and othe
Développeur & Formateur Java depuis 10 ans. Après avoir fait mes classes en société de services, J'ai créé la société TreeptiK
Développeur Java depuis plus de 10 ans, je m'intéresse à tout ce qui gravite autour et à l'intérieur d'une JVM.
En quête des meilleurs outils de développement et méthodes d'organisation des équipes.
longdesc:
Dimitri BAELI baigne dans l'univers Java depuis plus de 10 ans, sa passion pour les usines logicielles, l'organisation des développements, et les méthodes agiles ne l'empêche pas de mettre les mains dans le cambouis et développer des outils utiles aux développeurs.
Passionné par nature, participe très régulièrement à des conférences JUGs ou Agile Tour, co-organise l'étape Agile Tour Rouen chaque année.

shortdesc: Co-fondateur de Une Petite Mousse avec ses meilleures bières // Co-organisateur du Startup Weekend Grenoble et Human Talks Grenoble
Generalizing Specialist, intéressé par tous les aspects : fonctionnels, techniques et méthodologiques...

Développeur passionné chez Xebia. Java/Scala.
Akka lover.
ScrumMaster sur le site de petites annonces immobilières Explorimmo
Spring Framework team member.
consulting analyst, engaging speaker, skilled facilitator, occasional goof ball, playful father, devoted husband, and handsome fellow
longdesc:
Jeffrey Davidson is a Principal Consultant with ThoughtWorks, a leading Agile development firm with a passion to improve how businesses design, build and evolve software. He is also serving his peers as President of IIBA Dallas Chapter. 

Jeffrey's focus is helping organizations and Business Analysts transition to Agile, delivering great requirements, and building world-class analyst teams. An engaging and entertaining speaker, he speaks with passion to audiences across the country on business analysis and agile development. 

Jeffrey loves playing with his daughter, hanging out with his wife, reading a book, playing poker, and wasting time with computer games. You can find him online via twitter @JeffreyGoodReq and his blog, http://goodrequirements.com/.

shortdesc: Membre de l'équipe de développement de Spring et Google Developer Expert Dart.
Designer. Hacker. Researcher — CEO of Design & Human & blogger at Graphism.fr
longdesc: **Geoffrey Dorne** est designer et fondateur de Design & Human. Geoffrey est diplômé de l’Ensad et travaille le numérique et l’imprimé avec la Croix Rouge, la fondation Mozilla, la fondation Wikimedia, le Commissariat à l’Énergie Atomique, EDF, l'Agence Nationale de la recherche sur le sida, Samsung, Orange, Libération, etc. mais également de nombreuses startups, des laboratoires de recherche, des maisons d’éditions, des écoles (la Sorbonne, l'Ensci, les Gobelins, etc.) Geoffrey attache un intérêt particulier à l’humain, à la communication, aux interfaces, et aux métaphores, notamment après avoir été chercheur en design à l’EnsadLAB. Il a aussi créé le blog Graphism.fr.

shortdesc: Blogueur & Futurologue
longdesc: Blogueur & Futurologue

shortdesc: Programmer, Diversity Advocate, Author
longdesc: Ashe Dryden is an indie developer living in Madison, WI, USA. She's been involved with the web in some form or another over the course of the past 13 years. Ashe is an outspoken educator for diversity, inclusiveness, and empathy. She's currently writing a book on increasing diversity within companies, as well as working on a video series and site to serve as a resource to people who want to get involved. When she isn't discussing technology or it’s intersection with culture, she's cycling, tweeting, playing board games, debating the social implications of Star Trek episodes, being that awkward girl at the party, and waiting for her next burrito fix.

shortdesc: Open source system addict
Patrick Dunnam (Pakwit) along with Drew Woods make up GitHub's Streaming Eagle.
longdesc: Patrick Dunnam (Pakwit) along with Drew Woods make up GitHub's Streaming Eagle. The team was created accidentally, but quickly became a core component of improving the connection between GitHub HQ and GitHub's remote employees, who make up a majority of the company. Their tools have evolved rapidly from a single camcorder and a laptop, to an 8 camera multimedia broadcast jubilee complete with pre-show shenanigans and post-game wrap-up.

shortdesc: eXtreme Programmer passionné, Software craftsman et agiliste convaincu.
An interdiscplinary team of ne'er-do-wells, Streaming Eagle's purpose is to enhance and assist GitHub's culture via mixed media.
Founder of Teevity, a cloud costs analytics startup built on NetflixOSS, ex consultant on distributed, cloud based and SOA architectures
longdesc: After having been involved in the creation of many differents distributed sofware architectures for various customers, I decided he wanted to focus on building something by myself, and building the company that goes with it. Starting in 2012, I decided to focus on building all the tooling needed to deal with a new characteristics of modern architectures : costs. As Cloud computing is becoming increasingly popular among companies, IT folks and their managers need to face something new which is related to how effecient their IT systems are from a cost point of view.

shortdesc: ingénieur d'études chez **Treeptik** passionné par tout l'environnement Java et par **Docker**, participe activement au projet **CloudUnit**
Lean/Agile Coach with a software development background. Have a passion for Lean, Agile and LEGO
longdesc:
Håkan Forss is a Lean/Agile Coach, public speaker and author. He coaches, mentors and teaches Lean/Agile thinking, methods and tools to organizations, teams and individuals. He develops people’s ability to continuous learn and improve how work is done.

Håkan is an active member of the Kanban, Lean and Agile communities. He is an Accredited Kanban Trainer (AKT), a Kanban Coaching Professional (KCP) and he serves in the Kanban Coaching Professional Advisory board. He was also nominated for the Brickell Key Award 2013.

You can find Håkans random thoughts and thinking at http://twitter.com/hakanforss and http://hakanforss.wordpress.com

shortdesc: Professional Geek. Freelance. Java Champion.
longdesc:
Bonjour, je suis David Gageot, développeur indépendant. Ma passion ? L'écriture de logiciels pointus mais simples. J'ai pour leitmotiv d'être un facilitateur qui, par ma créativité et mon expertise, aide les équipes à être plus innovantes et plus efficaces.

Je participe à des projets Java depuis 1998, comme responsable R&D chez l'éditeur Adesoft puis directeur technique chez Valtech Technology, CTO chez Algodeal, un fond d'investissement quantitatif puis développeur chez SonarSource, la société derrière Sonar.

Vous suivez peut-être mon blog JavaBien! depuis 2004.

shortdesc: Directeur des Opérations et de l'Innovation
longdesc: Directeur des Operations et de L'innovation chez SFEIR, Didier Girard est Docteur en Informatique de l'ENS Lyon. Il aime acquérir des connaissances et les partager. Toujours à la recherche de technologies qui va s'imposer sur le marché dans les années à venir. Il travaille sur des projets mettant en oeuvre le Cloud Computing depuis 2008.

shortdesc:
Expert en Interfaces Innovantes à OCTO : Kinect, Leap, EyeTracking, Glass...
MVP et fondateur de la communauté des développeurs Kinect
longdesc:
De la 1ère bulle internet à aujourd’hui, Du Cobol à HTML 5, De la ligne de commande aux Interfaces Naturelles (NUI), j’ai vu passé presque tous les types d’interfaces homme-machine. Je me concentre actuellement sur les interfaces gestuelles telles que Kinect et LeapMotion

Je suis Expert en Technologies Innovantes et Interfaces Naturelles à OCTO Technology et Fondateur de la communauté des développeurs Kinect de France (http://kinectgeniusbar.com). Microsoft m’a gratifié du titre MVP (Most Valuable Professional) sur Kinect for Windows

shortdesc: I am founder of the #PoDojo learning community of fearless product makers
longdesc:
I help startups, product groups and established organisations moving, pivoting, innovating and changing their culture by agile coaching and training. My tools range from Scrum and Kanban to Design Thinking and Lean Startup. I have a strong practical background in product and service development which helps me being a great coach and mentor for teams and individuals in this field.

A common theme in my work is cultural change, which I approach with a hacker's attitude towards breaking rules to foster innovation and finding new ways to deal with socio-technical complexity. I am founder of the #PoDojo training and learning community for Product Owners, the Agile Game Lab Berlin for making and playing learning games and the business culture hacking community.

shortdesc:
Freelance, Software Craftsman, Agiliste
Scala, Java, Javascript,
longdesc: Jean Helou est développeur depuis 10 ans, passé Freelance lors de son arrivée à Lyon fin 2013. Avec un fort background en programmation impérative et objet, mais également de solides bases en programmations fonctionnelle il aime à combiner les deux approches. Curieux et passionné, il participait à l'organisation des Scala user groups parisiens et compte lancer leur équivalent lyonnais :)

shortdesc: Finding better ways of developing software, focusing on what matters ...
longdesc:
I am an **advocate, coach, trainer** and **mentor** for companies looking to find a better way to work by applying Agile values and principles in a productive, fulfilling, and fun way.

As an experienced workshop facilitator, **I love helping people visualise, create and test new strategies** by building and sharing 3-D models in a team dialogue using LEGO® Serious Play® materials and methods. (I’m a trained and licensed StrategicPlay® facilitator using LEGO® Serious Play.)

Although I was skeptical of Agile at first (and attended Certified Scrum Master training *on a dare*), I came to embrace the change that Agile promises.  **As a practicing Scrum Master I honed my craft with multiple teams and organisations, so I know how to promote change in an organisation from the inside.** I’ve adapted my years of project management and development experience into a passion for working with managers and teams. **With trust *and* integrity we *are* finding betters ways of developing software together.**

I’m based in Zurich, Switzerland (by way of Dallas, Texas and Picayune Mississippi).  I speak English and German. I enjoy cooking, swimming in Swiss rivers, biking and “hobby journalism”. I have more than a passing obsession with the Eurovision Song Contest which is indexed by Google, so I can’t hide it.

**You can find me online at http://steveholyer.com.** I’m looking forward to meeting a lot of people passionate about better software development at Mix-IT.

shortdesc: Passionné de création logicielle. Consultant et formateur avant tout.
longdesc:
Olivier Huber est un passionné de création logicielle.
Pour lui, notre métier est l'un des rares à nous donner la capacité de matérialiser une idée rapidement et quasiment gratuitement.
Initié il y a plus de dix ans à l'agilité par la pratique de l'eXtrême Programming, il devient Agiliste convaincu et Scrum Master par la suite.
Il intervient principalement depuis 14 ans en développement / conseil / formation chez des grands comptes qui ont des besoins Java, JEE et Web de façon générale, à la fois côté serveur (Spring, Hibernate, JPA et leurs amis…) ou client (AngularJS, GWT, Wicket, jQuery, Twitter Bootstrap).
Il rejoint Zenika en 2008 et évolue parmi des collègues qui ont la même ferveur et aime partager (formations, conférences, …) au maximum ses connaissances.

shortdesc: Programmeur indépendant. CTO @ Serpodile. #craftsmanship
Supporter de la pensée Agile au delà de l'IT, comme solution pour une entreprise responsable.
longdesc: La biographie détaillé de Oana peut être trouvé sur  http://fr.linkedin.com/in/oanajuncu

shortdesc: Software Engineer at Twitter.
Expert Java et Linux dans une grande entreprise française ; développeur Debian .
Groovy project manager
longdesc:
As Head of [Groovy](http://groovy.codehaus.org/) Development for **Pivotal**, Guillaume Laforge is the official **Groovy Project Manager**.
He initiated the creation of the [Grails](http://grails.org/) web application framework, and founded the [Gaelyk project](http://gaelyk.appspot.com/), a lightweight toolkit for developing applications in Groovy for **Google App Engine**.
He is also a **frequent conference speaker** presenting Groovy, Grails, Gaelyk, Domain-Specific Languages at JavaOne, GR8Conf, SpringOne2GX, QCon, and Devoxx, among others.
Guillaume also **co-authored** [Groovy in Action](http://www.manning.com/koenig/) along with Dierk König and Paul King, two famous Groovy committers.
Guillaume is also one of the founding members of [the French Java/OSS/IT podcast LesCastCodeurs](http://lescastcodeurs.com/).

shortdesc: Co-founder and President of La Paillasse, one of the world's largest community lab for biotech - Synthetic Biologist - Biohacker
longdesc: Thomas is the co-founder and president of the nonprofit organization "La Paillasse" in Paris, one of the world's largest community laboratories, commonly called hackerspaces, that foster open access and open source biotechnologies. He is an active member of the Do-it-yourself Biology (DIYbio) community, organizing the launch of DIYbio Europe, and working regularly as one of its spokespersons. Convinced that the 21st century will be the century of biotechnologies, he has been focusing on making biology more accessible to use as a technology for citizens and amateurs, developing cheap genetic diagnostic and creative use of biomaterials. He is currently finishing his Synthetic Biology PhD studies at iSSB, a CNRS-Genopole research institution.

shortdesc: Hey, I'm Jens. Applying design methods, I facilitate creative collaboration, to help teams to focus on customer value.
longdesc:
Since 15 years I'm supporting teams and managers in marketing, product management, innovation and IT to innovate with a focus on customer and user value. In the fuzzy front end of innovation, I incorporate stakeholders, departments and externals into cross-functional creative collaboration. 

With a background as an expert for marketing communication, industrial, interaction and brand design, I facilitate co-creation workshops applying service design thinking as an innovation method, work out design and communication concepts and steer project teams as a Scrum Product Owner across departments and companies - for medium-sized as well as big enterprises like Airbus (Aviation), Otto (Retail), CoreMedia (Software) or Gruner & Jahr (Publishing). 

I'm active part of the Service Design Community. I'm co-organizing the professional community www.service-design-hamburg.de, I'm engaged in the Service Design Berlin Community and the Global Service/Sustainability Jams (www.globalservicejam.org), and I'm part of the Modal Network that explores the intersections between lean, agile, and service design thinking. 

I'm passionate about all kind of creative outcome like design, art, music or architecture. I love my old car, my new bicycle, and gardening in my datscha near Berlin.

shortdesc: I'm here to learn...
longdesc: Il a travaillé pour plusieurs sociétés en Afrique comme développeur et aussi Administrateur Système. Multi-récidive dans les actions communautaires pour que le Développeur africain se montre sur un meilleur jour dans les sociétés, il participe aux activités des JUG et GDG etc.

shortdesc:
Jardinière agile, chez Agile Garden
Formation, accompagnement, facilitation
longdesc:
Dans mon parcours de chef de projet / assistante à maîtrise d'ouvrage, j'ai un jour eu l'opportunité de tenir le rôle de Product Owner d'un grand projet de refonte. Je n'ai plus voulu sortir de l'agilité.
Aujourd'hui, je suis coach agile. Au delà de la mise en place de nouveaux cadres de travail au sein des équipes, c'est une prise de conscience de l'ensemble des acteurs que je recherche. Avec, en ligne de mire, une équipe qui fonctionne, et des personnes plus épanouies professionnellement.

shortdesc: Software Engineer spécialisé sur Android. Passionné par la vie des communautés et les projets innovants.
longdesc:
- Software Engineer chez Genymobile, spécialisé sur Android et le développement web http://www.genymobile.com
- Trésorier du Paris Android User Group http://paug.fr
- Créateur du podcast Android Devcast le podcast Android pour les professionnels et les développeurs http://android-devcast.com
- Google Developer Expert Android https://developers.google.com/experts/members/

Je fais de l'Android depuis début 2009.
Après différents projets R&D chez les opérateurs et un poste technique B2B chez Samsung, je travaille actuellement dans l'équipe de développement de Genymotion, un émulateur Android.

shortdesc: Software Craftsman, `[BD]DD` Fan boy and Java specialist
Architecte Java EE et Web chez Zenika Lyon
longdesc: Matthieu Lux est Architecte Java EE et Web au sein de l'agence lyonnaise de Zenika. (@Swiip & http://swiip.github.com/) Il intervient en conseil et en réalisation Java et JavaScript. Sa contribution technique à de nombreux projets Web, dont le plus visible http://www.meteofrance.com, lui a permis d'être expert à la fois dans les architectures Java EE (Spring, Hibernate, JPA ...), dans le Web (HTML5, AngularJS, GWT, jQuery, Backbone JS, Twitter Bootstrap ...) et dans le domaine de la mobilité (Android, PhoneGap ...). Passionné de JavaScript, il participe également à l'animation du Lyon JS.

shortdesc: Director, Europe at VersionOne, public speaker, award-winning author of "Commitment"
longdesc:
Olav Maassen is a consultant, public speaker and writer.

Olav's agile experience, along with his professional coaching and training abilities help him align teams with the company objectives effectively: teams and organizations reach their goals faster. His excellent listening skills combined with his keen observations allow him to provide feedback (both personal as well as organizational) that is on target and always directed towards improvement.

Olav Maassen's groundbreaking book on managing project risk, real option theory and decision making is published on May 14, 2013. 

Olav Maassen specializes in:
* Leading the Agile organization
* Project Management
* Team development
* Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, XP)
* Decision making and Real Options thinking

shortdesc: Has been a software professional for more than 10 years consultant top teams on technical leadership, process agility and clean code.
longdesc:
Has been a software professional for more than 10 years. Passionate about learning from experience especially when dealing with real-life software projects. As a trainer and consultant works with top teams on technical leadership, process agility and clean code. Co-conducts in-depth researches on critical success factors in software development. At top of that Mariusz has published dozens of articles in Software Developer Journal and Polish “The Programist” magazine.
His motto is “In most cases it’s all about people” what drives his focus towards communication and team members cooperation. Domain experience: Telco, Finances, Insurance, Manufacturing, E-commerce.
His thoughts can be followed on twitter @ms_bnsit_pl or his blog http://msieraczkiewicz.blogspot.com

shortdesc: JavaScript developer, writer, speaker, and organizer. Big fan of making stuff.
longdesc: Garann has been making websites since the early days. She spent time as a full-stack developer writing Java and .NET before refocusing on the front-end and, eventually, JavaScript. In addition to her full-time work, she's an acquisitions scout for A List Apart, and is always looking to meet developers who also share her passion for writing and sharing their knowledge.

shortdesc: Agile trainer and coach. M30 Licensed Trainer. 'Agile Management' and 'Agile Kaizen' author. Dark Lord of Agile Sith. Crazy Spaniard.
longdesc:
Ángel Medinilla (Córdoba, Spain, 1973) has 15+ years working experience in the ICT market. On 2007 he started his own Agile Consulting firm. Today, Proyectalis is considered the leading Agile consulting and coaching company in Spain, offering Agile training, consulting and implementation services to a wide spectrum of software, telco and internet local and worlwide companies. Customers include Ericsson, Vodafone, Electronic Arts, EADS, Abengoa, Odigeo, Auchan, Tui Travel, Schibsted, Thomson Reuters…

He is a regular speaker at Agile conferences in Sweden, Finland, Germany, Netherlands, Belgium, United States, Ireland, Israel, United Kingdom, Slovenia, Austria, Czech Republic, Poland, Portugal, France and, of course, Spain,

He is a Management 3.0 Licensed Trainer and a member of both the Scrum Alliance and the Agile Alliance. He is also a well known member of the Spanish Agile community, co-founder of Agile Spain and also a sponsor and chairman of the first Agile events ever done in Spain: Agile Open Space 2009 and Agile Spain Conference 2010.

He is the author of Agile Management  (Springer) and also contributed to Beyond Agile: Stories of Agile Transformations,  (Modus Cooperandi). He is currently working on a 2014 upcoming book: 'Agile Kaizen – Continuous Improvement Far Beyond Retrospectives'

shortdesc: Chief Agility Officer
longdesc: Alexis est Chief Agility Officer d’eNovance, un contributeur majeur au projet Openstack et un acteur de l’écosystème du cloud open source. La mission d’Alexis est de créer et nourrir une culture de l’agilité dans toute l’organisation. 20 ans d’expérience, depuis l’industrie automobile, l’épopée du démarrage d’Internet, le conseil, le secteur public, qui l’ont amené à fonder Ayeba, société de conseil en organisation combinant les domaines humain, management et digital pour accompagner la réussite des entreprises. Impliqué dans le monde associatif et conférencier dans les domaines du management, des méthodes agiles et du numérique.

shortdesc: Développeur web puis maker, j'enfile au fablab ces deux casquettes pour  créer des objets utiles, notamment dans le projet Handilab.
Hacking everything
Java, Joueur, Joyeux et aussi au JUG Lyon de temps en temps
longdesc:
Tombé dans l'IT il y a une douzaine d'année j'aime échanger avec tous les acteurs de ce domaine.
Plus particulièrement attaché (émotionnellement) au code et à Java. J'aime bien faire du conseil, de la formation et toute forme d'accompagnement technique.

Mes valeurs :

- **l'échange**
- la découverte

Ce que j'aime dans le boulot :

- progresser et **faire progresser**
- me mettre à la place de l'utilisateur pour challenger ce que l'on me demande de coder

Ce que je regarde en ce moment :

- **Devops** 
- Docker
- Rundeck
- Déploiement continu
- Chrome apps avec cordova
- AngularJs
- BigData
- SIG
- http://www.squirt.io/ (comment lire plus de 400 mots/minute)

Mes projets hors du boulot :

- Faire marcher **Elliott**
- Voyager
- Apprendre le russe (ça fait des années que je dois m'y mettre sérieusement)
- Une balade en moto
- Arrêter de bricoler un ordi, un raspberryPi ou autre pour passer plus de temps au soleil

shortdesc: Passionné par le Web et le logiciel Libre, Tristan Nitot contribue au projet Mozilla depuis 1998. Il a fondé Mozilla Europe en 2003.
[React](http://reactjs.org) maintainer. I also work on JS at Facebook. Previously I worked on Firefox at Mozilla.
Freelance, aimerait devenir un bon développeur logiciel! Evangéliste agile, fervent défenseur du TDD et du BDD.
Développeur .NET / Javascript Freelance
Sven is a software geek working as an Ambassador for Atlassian. Besides coding his passion is helping devs kick-ass.
longdesc: Sven Peters is a software geek working as an Ambassador for Atlassian. He started with Java development in 1998 and has been programming for longer that he'd like to admit. Besides coding his passion is effective software development, keeping developers motivated, and helping them kick-ass. Sven has extensive speaking experience in 20+ countries on myriad topics.

shortdesc: Développeur Java full stack, adepte de l'agilité.
coach and quality advocate; passionate about lean-kanban, continuous improvement and motivational design
longdesc: Currently a learning and development architect at ThoughtWorks, I have worked in software development as a coach, trainer, quality advocate and facilitator. I am particularly passionate about behavior-driven development, lean-kanban, continuous improvement and motivational design.

shortdesc: Passionné de dev web, Git, Rails et JS (JS lui-même, CoffeeScript, Node, Backbone, etc.). Auteur de bouquins dev, formateur JS/Git…
life coach, team whisperer, community creator, holding space for change
longdesc:
I increase joy in the workplace by helping people do better work and enjoy it more, through personal and team effectiveness coaching. 

I am a certified Co-Active personal coach, an experienced Scrum coach and trainer, and I organise and facilitate Open Space conferences in three languages, such as the AgileCoachCamps Naresh Jain and I started in 2008. Mix-IT is an exception for me... I attend almost exclusively unconferences, myself, and I also teach first-time Open Space facilitators the ropes, to help spread the Open Space meme. I am a founding member of the StoosNetwork.org and a passionate connector.

I'm married to Ilja Preuß, an Agile coach, developer and facilitator, and we live in Karlsruhe, Germany. I moved here from Quebec five years ago, just across the river from Strasbourg! I am busy re-learning my first (or third?) language, German - but it is so nice to come to France and speak my beloved second language, too! I look forward to meeting you all!

Find me on the web at http://abiggerga.me/
(and please do book a free Vision Session while you are there, I love doing those!)

shortdesc: Architecte Technique et Entrepreneur passionné d'innovation et ayant passé 10 ans dans la Silicon Valley. #GlassExplorer
Je suis une geek, passionnée de web et de vin. Je partage ma vie entre ces deux passions avec un immense bonheur !
Senior Software Engineer chez Red Hat. Co-spec lead sur la specification CDI et tech lead sur le projet Agorava
longdesc: Après avoir travaillé pendant plus de 15 ans dans différentes société de service en informatique, Antoine est aujourd’hui employé chez Red Hat ou il co-dirige la spécification CDI et est en charge du développement de l’éco-système CDI. Il est également tech lead sur le projet Agorava permettant de développer des applications clientes des principaux réseaux sociaux.

shortdesc: Co-fondateur de la Cordée, je suis passionné de projets collaboratifs, de projets fous, et de projets de randonnées en montagne !
Passionné d’automatisation, aime réfléchir à comment éviter de réfléchir.
longdesc:
Olivier Servieres est un développeur Web passionné d’automatisation, qui aime réfléchir à comment éviter de réfléchir. Il met actuellement en pratique sa culture de l’optimisation du cycle de développement chez TEA.

Ses différentes expériences l’ont mené des moteurs de recherche aux plateformes de casual gaming, en passant par des serveurs de jeu multijoueurs, avec une constante : des web services développés au sein d’équipes agiles.

shortdesc: A programmer turned rouge, I work as a Lean and Kanban coach. My quest is learning what it takes to succeed with software.
longdesc:
Co-auther to Kanban and Scrum - making the most of both.

I've helped several companies in gaming, business intelligence and public sector reduce lead time, produce better stuff and have more fun doing it.
I work and train over the full value chain, to get the most out of the capabilities of the company.

shortdesc: Mission : co-changer le monde à base de Scrum, Kanban, jeux agiles, facilitation, curiosité et nécessité de rester en mouvement.
longdesc:
Issu du monde du de la conduite de projets de développement logiciel, co-fondateur de Agile Nantes, puis créateur associé de Agile Garden, Pierrick accompagne depuis plusieurs années les équipes et les organisations qui cherchent à obtenir des améliorations concrètes au travers des pratiques, valeurs et principes agiles. Son but : co-changer le monde ! 
Dans sa besace : Scrum, Kanban, jeux agiles, facilitation graphique, curiosité et la nécessité de rester en mouvement.

shortdesc: Mobile + web developer.
\#linux #web #livre #photo #ebook #geekeries_diverses
Développeur de jeux vidéo, créateur de Monkey Moon, programmeur curieux et passionné.
longdesc:
Natural born curious, gamer, and dreamer, I always loved making "cool" things with my computer. I worked several years on 'AAA' console games for major publishers and now I'm making my way as an indie with a company called Monkey Moon.
With Monkey Moon my goal is to make original games of quality made with passion and love for shiny pixels.
Because I'm hungered for new learnings, I'm a bit more than a code monkey.

shortdesc: A founding member of GitHub's Streaming Eagles
longdesc: Patrick Dunnam (Pakwit) along with Drew Woods make up GitHub's Streaming Eagle. The team was created accidentally, but quickly became a core component of improving the connection between GitHub HQ and GitHub's remote employees, who make up a majority of the company. Their tools have evolved rapidly from a single camcorder and a laptop, to an 8 camera multimedia broadcast jubilee complete with pre-show shenanigans and post-game wrap-up.

shortdesc: Owner, Change agent and Transformation coach
longdesc: A passionate, highly skilled and knowledgeable consultant, coach and trainer of Lean and Agile principles and practices. With over 6 years of international experience in this field Ozlem Yuce provides advice and guidance to senior leaders and teams helping them to improve the way they work. She helps organisations to innovate faster by changing the way people think and act in the complex environments that they work in.
